Posts.EditableText:
Google says it's when protesters throw a milkshake at a speaker. Now it is being decided if it is a crime or what level of crime. I would much rather have a milkshake thrown at me than a list of other things...

That's all I know

Posts.EditableText:
> Google says it's when protesters throw a milkshake at a speaker.

Yeah, I see it happening on YouTube.  I was wondering if anyone in the U.K. could fill me in on the oranges... or the oranges... or the beginnings of the phenomenon.

(Sorry.  I was talking like I was suffering through a brain-fart for a second there.  A lot of people don't know this, but it's kind of hard to say "origins", you know, so many people are saying "oranges" instead.  You can see it happening, and you people know it better than anybody.  OK?)

> At first, I thought it might be a new thing like twerking....kinda disappointed.

Fret not!  It was all about shaking some boobies a while back:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pGL2rytTraA

---
> “What’s a milkshaking? I WANT ONE.”
-Buddy the Elf

You sit on a throne of LIES!!!

---
> It could also mean this:

A life lesson for the ladies:  If you shake your <s>boobies</s> necklace at us in a video, you will be remembered for it!

---
Seriously, ladies,

We respect your bodies and your minds equally, and we can prove it.  Just give us a chance (and permission)!
